intro: Cyanea procera, commonly known as the giant hibiscus, is a striking tropical plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter, typically displaying vibrant red, yellow, or orange hues. The plant has a robust, woody stem with broad, waxy leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in humid, sunny environments and is often found growing in coastal or lowland areas. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is a notable species in Hawaiian botany.
